result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly M Fromm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for early termination after 6 months with Agent approval.

miscConds.notes:
Court to apply the $2,000 cash bail on deposit in case 22CM1023 to Cost/Surcharge.  Remainder to be refunded to the poster.
COST PAID IN FULL.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No violent contact with Victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly M Fromm

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked Sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

03:33 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Kimberly M Fromm in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Miller advises her client is prepared to proceed with plea and sentencing today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Miller confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Miller.


COUNT 1:
Court orders the following:

60 Days Jail.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year & 6 Months - Court will allow for early termination after 6 Months with Agent approval.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended  by Agent
No Violent contact with: Victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

COSTS:  $343.00 (includes DV surcahrge);
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
**Court to apply the $2,000.00 cash bail on deposit in case 22CM1023; remainder to be refunded to the poster.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:33 AM File not called on the record
Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kimberly M Fromm in court by zoom with attorney Cassandra Miller. 
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Miller requests a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any VIOLENT contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:35 AM Defendant Kimberly M Fromm in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant states she has reached out to Attorney Cassandra Miller on several occasions and has not received a response.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
